title: A Cool Feature to have When choosing your Role
body:
I was talking with one of my friends and he had brought up a good idea.
If an individual picks the Fill option when picking his/her role, they have their secondary allows them the option to exclude a role.
So, if you don't mind most roles, but you have one that you would rather not play, you get that choice, while still opting in for 4/5 of the available roles.
Personally, I would love to see this added to the game, there should be more people picking the fill option and with only 1 role excluded per each user choosing fill, it should decrease queue timers. I'm sure many would like to do fill, if not for that one role that they dislike strongly.


_**UPDATE:**_: Many people have made mention that Riot has tried this on other servers and it has gotten negative reviews. This was dated back over a year ago. Currently, I believe support has been seeing a lot more play and has been given plenty of attention since to make it a much more attractive role. I would like to see a test run implemented for a brief amount of time on the NA server to see how it affects our server. If it goes negatively, then yeah, get rid of it, however I think it is worth a try again. Also, how long did the test run on the OCE server?

I see this as an option for people who don't want to support, but also want more variety to the roles they get. (Personally, I'm a support main this season. I use to hate the role, but it has grown on me and is now one of my favorite positions to take)

In addition to what many have mentioned: Although this sounds very contradicting, maybe the support role could be an option you can't object.

We've already had these discussions about any type of role exclusions.
It doesn't solve for anything. It only prolongs queue times and has the potential to autofill a player into the role your team needs that's lower ELO if this happens.

Imagine 5 buckets that sort the elements according to role.
Top, Jungle, Mid, Bot, Support. Under any type of exclusions, you can sort elements according to at most 4 roles but exclude one bucket completely. That bucket will always have less elements in it and once all of the elements have been matched, the element that's in shortage is always going to become a bottleneck for the entire queue experience.

That means queueing up for longer because the matchmaker is searching for a role that's missing and is still relatively in your ELO/skill level. If it doesn't find anyone for quite some time, its search parameters widen and then people from lower ELOs will get included. Filling a role with a player who's less skilled than your average team ELO is also bad because you're likely to lose from the position that's the weakest link.
---
You can't skip autofill because the role distribution isn't equal among the roles. Players will naturally gravitate towards their own favorites and will always have the least favorite ones to play as.
